SEC. 101. Extension of the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Block Grant Program through March 31, 2004. Activities authorized by part A of title IV of the Social Security Act, and by sections 510, 1108(b), and 1925, shall continue through March 31, 2004, with necessary appropriations from the Treasury. Grants and payments can be made for these activities in the first two quarters of fiscal year 2004 at the 2002 level. Amendments are made for supplemental grants in certain states. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act for fiscal year 2002, including changes to supplemental grants in certain states and adjustments to contingency funds and maintenance of effort requirements. Amendments to the Social Security Act for fiscal year 2002 include changes to contingency funds and maintenance of effort requirements, with updates to deadlines for 2004 and 2005. The National Random Sample Study of Child Welfare and Child Welfare Waiver Authority is extended through March 31, 2004, with necessary appropriations from the Treasury. Grants and payments will continue at the same level as in fiscal year 2002. Additionally, there is a provision for the disclosure of return information to carry out income contingent repayment of student loans. TITLE II--TAX PROVISIONS

SEC. 201. Disclosure of return information for income contingent repayment of student loans is extended to December 31, 2004.

SEC. 202. Extension of Internal Revenue Service user fees with a new section added to Chapter 77 of the Internal Revenue Code. The Secretary will establish a program for user fees on requests to the IRS for ruling letters, opinion letters, and determination letters. Fees will vary based on categories, be determined by request complexity, and must be paid in advance. Exemptions and reduced fees will be provided as deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The Secretary will establish a program for user fees on requests to the IRS for ruling letters, opinion letters, and determination letters. Fees will vary based on categories and request complexity, with exemptions and reduced fees provided as deemed appropriate. SEC. 301 of TITLE III extends COBRA fees from September 30, 2003, to March 31, 2004. SEC. 401 of TITLE IV extends Medicare cost-sharing for certain qualifying individuals. Extension of Sunset for Medicare Cost-Sharing: Amends Section 1902(a)(10)(E)(iv) of the Social Security Act to extend the sunset provision to March 2004. Total Amount Available for Allocation: Modifies Section 1933(c) to include fiscal year 2003 in addition to 2002 for allocation purposes. The Social Security Act is amended to include fiscal years 2002 and 2003 for certain provisions. A special rule is added for the first quarter of 2004 regarding the selection and assistance of qualifying individuals. For the period from January 1, 2004, to March 31, 2004, a State must select qualifying individuals and provide assistance as per the rules in effect for 2003. The total allocation amount for this period is $100,000,000. SEC. 402. EXTENSION OF EQUALIZED MEDICARE INPATIENT HOSPITAL PAYMENTS.
